intro: Rhodanthe polyphylla, commonly known as the many-leaved rhytidophyll, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange flowers and dense, feathery foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its flowers bloom in spring and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and birds. Rhodanthe polyphylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in harsh environments.
